titleStmt.title: A true relation; of a most dreadful fire which happened on the city of Udem or Uhien in Germany together, with an account of the regulars, monastries, churches, houses, people, and cattle, that suffered in those most devouring flames, very remarkable, and not inferiour to that of London.
titleStmt.author: I. D.

titleStmt.title: A true relation; of a most dreadful fire which happened on the city of Udem or Uhien in Germany together, with an account of the regulars, monastries, churches, houses, people, and cattle, that suffered in those most devouring flames, very remarkable, and not inferiour to that of London.
titleStmt.author: I. D.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by E. Mallet in Black-Horse-Ally, near Fleet-Bridge,

notesStmt.note: Signed and dated at end: April the 13th. 85. You obliged frind [sic] and servant I.D.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
